page.title: 01Ewerby and Howell
page.content: The land east of Howell is flat fen with no public roads. The village of Ewerby is expanding with a number of medium & large houses being built 1982/85. The residents of these & other houses work in agriculture or travel to Sleaford & other towns to work. Children travel to Kirkby La Thorpe or Sleaford schools. Ewerby has a thriving community organization with dances & other events in the Reading Room. The other hamlets & isolated houses are mainly occupied by farmers or farmworkers. The crops are mainly arable with sheep being used as a break on some farms, foraging sugar beet residues or forage crops. Ewerby Church has a fine peal of 10 bells, much visited at weekends by bellringers from all over the country.
